title: President’s Reflections: Blue Shield International in 2025
content: 2025 has been another busy, exciting, positive (and occasionally) frustrating year. title: Peacekeeping and Heritage: BSI at the UN Training School Ireland
content: Course participants outside the United Nations Training School, Curragh Camp. In November, Blue Shield International led the fourth iteration of the Cultural Property Protection Course with the United Nations Training School Ireland, Curragh Camp, Ireland. title: Blue Shield International appoints Callum Peebles as Interim Director
content: Callum brings two decades of experience leading humanitarian efforts in conflict areas. Blue Shield International is pleased to announce the appointment of Callum Peebles as its Interim Director, effective November 2025. Callum joins us from The HALO Trust, the largest and oldest landmine clearance organisation in the world, where he was most recently Director of Programmes. title: Blue Shield Statement on Sudan

title: “Strengthen Appreciation”: Malians celebrate at Tomb of Askia
content: Visit of the Mayor to see the restoration work © Blue Shield Mali Restoration work has been ongoing at the Tomb of Askia. title: Happy Anniversary to our National Committees
content: This year we are celebrating the 25th anniversary of the founding of our first national committees! In 2000, the first national committees were founded, and Blue Shield became a truly worldwide organisation, protecting heritage in crisis.
